data.Sentence_cn: 当艾斯卡罗比亚国的大使回到家吃午饭时，把他的夫人吓了一跳。
data.Sentence: When the Ambassador of Escalopia returned home for lunch, his wife got a shock.

data.Sentence_cn: 他面色苍白，衣服也搞得不成样子。
data.Sentence: He looked pale and his clothes were in a frightful state.

data.Sentence_cn: “发生了什么事？”她问，“你的衣服怎么搞得一塌糊涂？”
data.Sentence: 'What has happened?' she asked. 'How did your clothes get into such a mess?'

data.Sentence_cn: “灭火器弄的，亲爱的，”大使冷冷地回答，
data.Sentence: 'A fire extinguisher, my dear,' answered the Ambassador drily.

data.Sentence_cn: “今天上午大学生们放火点着了大使馆。”
data.Sentence: 'University students set the Embassy on fire this morning.'

data.Sentence_cn: “天啊！”他的夫人惊叫，“那你当时在什么地方？”
data.Sentence: 'Good heavens!' exclaimed his wife. 'And where were you at the time?'

data.Sentence_cn: “我和往常一样，在办公室里，”大使回答说。
data.Sentence: 'I was in my office as usual,' answered the Ambassador.

data.Sentence_cn: “地下室突然着火，我当然马上下去了。
data.Sentence: 'The fire broke out in the basement. I went down immediately, of course,

data.Sentence_cn: 但那个傻瓜霍斯特把灭火器对准了我。
data.Sentence: and that fool, Horst, aimed a fire extinguisher at me.
He thought I was on fire.

data.Sentence_cn: 我一定要把那个家伙打发走。”
data.Sentence: I must definitely get that fellow posted.'

data.Sentence_cn: 大使夫人继续提出问题，她突然又发现丈夫的帽子上有个洞。
data.Sentence: The Ambassador's wife went on asking questions, when she suddenly noticed a big hole in her husband's hat.

data.Sentence_cn: “那么你对那又作何解释呢？”她问。
data.Sentence: 'And how can you explain that?' she asked.

data.Sentence_cn: “有人向我办公室窗户开了一枪。
data.Sentence: 'Someone fired a shot through my office window.
Fortunately, I wasn't wearing it at the time.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果真戴着它，我现在就不能回家来吃午饭了。”
data.Sentence: If I had been, I would not have been able to get home for lunch.'
